$5000 and above: Please add $200.00

story:
We are the Ecology Center, a non-profit environmental organization in Ann Arbor, Michigan that works for a safe and healthy environment. One of our most popular projects is HealthyStuff.org, our in-house lab that tests consumer products for toxic chemicals.  Our lab uses a High Definition X-Ray Fluorescence (HD XRF) analyzer, infra-red spectroscopy and third-party labs to analyze products.   Since 2007, our HealthyStuff.org lab has tested over 10,000 consumer products receiving national media coverage for  studies that have found toxic chemicals in a range of consumer goods including cars,  gardening products, jewelry, and mobile phones – but most importantly - children's car seats!  However, it's been awhile since our last car seat study (2011 - time for an upgrade, don't you think?) and that's why we need your help - we want to test children's car seats this summer!

Why we want to test car seats this summer:

In 2011, we tested over 150 car seats and found more than half (60%) contained at least one of the following chemicals: bromine (associated with brominated flame retardants); chlorine (indicating the presence of polyvinyl chloride, or PVC and plasticizers); lead; other heavy metals, and allergens. 

Here are our 2011 Best and Worst Picks:


Brominated flame retardants are chemicals that are either deemed toxic or lack adequate health safety data. They were detected in 44% percent of the 2011 car seats tested. Other studies have found that car seats contain hazardous chlorinated and organo-phosphate based flame retardants.

 

 It's 2014 and it's time for a fresh batch of car seats to test. Companies such as Graco,Orbit Baby,Britax andClek have released statements that they are phasing out the use of some of these hazardous chemicals from their car seats.  But the only way to find out is to put them to the test, which is what we plan to do this summer with your help!  

IMPORTANT REMINDER:   CAR SEATS SAVE LIVES. ALWAYS USE CHILD SAFETY SEATS, REGARDLESS OF THE RATINGS AT HealthyStuff.org. FOR MORE INFORMATION ON THE SAFE USE OF CAR SEATS, SEE CAR-SAFETY.ORG OR THE AMERICAN ACADEMY OF PEDIATRICS.

Car seats are necessary to safeguard children in cars, but hazardous chemicals are not necessary to make a quality car seat for children and infants!

The following are chemicals our lab will test for:

Bromine, Chlorine and organo-phosphate based flame retardants: Associated with the use of brominated flame retardants (BFRs), chlorinated flame retardants (CFRs) are added to plastics and foams for fire resistance to comply with auto fire safety standards.  Many brominated and chlorinated flame retardants appear to be persistent and bioaccumulative, resulting in food chain contamination, including human milk.  Many also lack adequate toxicity information, but the available data raises concerns. Some BFRs have been associated with thyroid problems, learning and memory impairment, decreased fertility, and behavioral changes.  Although fire retardants in foam are necessary to meet certain fire-safety standards, non-halogenated fire retardants are available, and many have a better safety profile. 

Chlorine: Associated with the use of polyvinyl chloride (PVC), which is widely used in plastics and is of concern to the environment and public health during all phases of its life cycle. PVC contains chemicals called phthalates, some of which are associated with decreased fertility, pre-term deliveries, and damage to the liver, testes, thyroid, ovaries, kidneys, and blood. There is also evidence that phthalates can pass from mothers to babies through the placenta and breast milk.

Lead: Lead is sometimes used as an additive in plastics. Exposure can result in a number of potential health effects, including brain damage, learning disabilities, and problems with the kidneys, blood, nerves, and reproductive system.

Other: Other chemicals tested as part of HealthyStuff.org include antimony, arsenic, chromium, cobalt, copper, mercury, nickel and tin. The substances in this category are allergens, carcinogens, or can cause other adverse health impacts depending on the dose.

Wouldn't you like to know if these chemicals are in the products you buy? 

 Your donation today will help fund: 

  • Purchasing of 15 - 20 Car Seats (2014 Models): $5,500 - $6,500
  • HD XRF testing and public posting of results: $2,000 - $3,500
  • Our HealthyStuff.org Researchers: $2,000-$3,000
  • Total: $9,000 - $13,000

We really hope we can complete this important study as it will not only provide valuable information to you but also pressure car seat manufacturers to phase out these toxic chemicals and replace them with healthier alternatives.  You'll not only be helping us, but will protect the health of children and their communities.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, it doesn't mean you can’t help:

  • Upload a picture of you with a print-out of our thought bubble, and tag one of our social media channels telling us why this campaign is important to you! You might get the chance to be featured as one of our "distinguished donors" based on your creativity!
  • Get the word out to your friends on and offline. We want to get as many people involved as we can and help educate people on why knowing what's in everyday products is important to their health and the health of the environment! 
  • Use any of the great share tools provided on our Indiegogo page. We have some funny memes you can share with family and friends! 

Thank you!

story:
Whole-Tree Building: A Hands-On Workshop

May 2&3,2015

MUM Sustainable Living Center, Fairfield Iowa

At The Maharishi University’s Sustainable Living Center, both students and visitors can learn about how a truly “green” building can match, and even exceed the comfort and beauty of a conventional building. One of the most enchanting features of the SL Center is the atrium, which features a day-lit cathedral ceiling, held aloft by locally harvested whole trees.


The architect behind the whole-tree design is Roald Gundersen. Gundersen’s expertise in whole-tree design is unsurpassed, and we are celebrating his return to the Sustainable Living Center by offering the public a rare opportunity to spend two days learning about whole-tree building with Roald.


This Indiegogo campaign is to invite you– wherever you are– to be a part of the experience. For those who want to attend the event, we offer the chance to come to Fairfield, Iowa and get the full, hands-on experience. If you can’t travel to Fairfield, we will offer digital downloads of Roald’s lectures, with highlights of the hands on workshop. Even if you can’t come in person, maybe you want to snag one of the limited edition t-shirts or other groovy perks, just to show your support!

We aren’t looking to raise a lot– just enough to cover workshop expenses, pay Roald a fair rate for his time and his travel expenses to come down from Wisconsin. If we go over our goal, any additional money will go into the student projects fund for sustainable living students to use for future workshops.  Please, share this campaign with your friends, and come to Fairfield to learn how you can join the “Slow Architecture” revolution!

Read about Roald in the New York Times.

story:
Creating an Artificial Oyster Reef

I'm Tim Moore.  I have a BS in Biology from VA Tech and my Masters from UNC's Kenan-Flagler Business School.  

From the NOAA Chesapeake Bay Office on Oyster Restoration:

"Although the native oyster is an extremely resilient species, able to tolerate wide variations in salinity and temperature, it has not been immune to the pressures of disease, overharvesting, and pollution. As a result, native oyster populations in Chesapeake Bay are at less than 1% of historic levels. This tremendous decline in the oyster population has dramatically changed the ecology of the Bay as well as the oyster fishery and the cultural tradition of watermen who harvest seafood from the Bay for a living. One of the responses to this decline has been attempts to restore oyster populations."

For the last three years I have been growing oysters on the Chesapeake Bay as a hobby.  I recently obtained a bottom lease from the State of Virginia and am in the process of creating an artificial oyster reef on it.  Creating an artificial oyster reef will do three major steps towards restoring the health of the Chesapeake Bay:  filter water, provide habitat for juvenile fish, and reduce pressure on native - wild oysters.

Oysters have an amazing ability to filter water.  An adult oyster can filter up to 50 gallons of water per day.  They remove algal blooms and sediment from the water column enhancing water clarity.  This allows light to penetrate to a greater distance and allows sea grasses to grow on the bottom.  These sea grasses provide habitat for juvenile fish, molting crabs, and mollusks. Oysters also remove both carbon and nitrogen from the water with their shells acting as a carbon sink to reduce the harmful effects of CO2 emissions on global warming.

Oyster reefs themselves provide shelter for juvenile fish and bottom structure to attract fish populations.  Fish of all sizes congregate around bottom structure – with smaller fish looking for protection and larger fish looking for shade and smaller fish.  Historically natural oyster reefs in the Chesapeake Bay provided this benefit but mechanical dredging over the past century has dramatically reduced the number of these reefs. 

Creating an artificial reef to grow oysters for market reduces the pressure on naturally occurring wild oysters.  This allows these wild oysters to reproduce and repopulate an area that had been depleted through years of over harvesting.  Planting and raising oysters through aquaculture also provides a consistent product for market and allows the traditional waterman a method of earning a living through a sustainable, environmentally responsible process.

Reef Creation

This contribution will be used to purchase polypropylene trays that will be used to construct an artificial oyster reef.  These trays are three feet square and have feet that hold them four inches off of the bottom allowing good water flow to the oysters inside.  Each stack of trays will hold between 500 to 1000 oysters depending on oyster size and will protect them from predators.  The cost of a stack of trays is $70, however if I buy in bulk the price drops to $50 each.  $20,000 works out to 400 stacks and will hold 200,000 adult oysters. The oysters are purchased from a local hatchery and have been bred to be disease resistant and optimized for growth for the specific salinity of the part of the Bay in which the reef will be deployed.

Every $10 contribution puts 100 oysters in the water.  Each 100 oysters filter roughly 1.8 million gallons of water per year, removing 10 pounds of CO2 in the form of calcium carbonate in the process.

For people who are interesting in helping in this process, for every $1000 contribution I will host you and a guest at my house on the water and you can assist in the oyster reef building process for a weekend. 

Please feel free to share this exciting venture with your friends.  I look forward to your help in cleaning up the Bay one oyster at a time!

Thank you,

Tim

story:
Short Summary

We, Andie Kingsbury and Stephanie Salisbury, know what it's like to live on a strained budget. Raising 12 kids between our two families, we've had to struggle, juggle, reduce, re-use, recycle, and reinvent the wheel at times. It's given us both a heart for ministering to other families in the midst of the same struggle, and what better place to start than our own town? So, we co-founded Green Olive Ministries.

Elkhart County, Indiana, has one of the highest unemployment rates in the nation, forcing many to visit food pantries on a regular basis. One of the caveats is that pantries rarely have diapers available, and food stamps will not allow diaper purchases. It is our idea with this project to impact the cycle of poverty in this area by training women to create their own cloth diapers for home use and also by paying another set forward to a local food pantry. In this manner, the women will be learning a valuable skill, eliminating the need for disposables (and, in turn, eliminating the massive amount of waste that disposables create in our landfills), and gaining a sense of community by working together with us and other women who know what it's like to live on an extremely strained budget. The diapers we create use snaps, enabling the same set of diapers to be used for a newborn as for a nearly-potty trained toddler. They last for years, and can be handed down to the next child in line after potty-training. ONE SET OF THESE DIAPERS ELIMINATES AT LEAST TWO YEARS OF DISPOSABLES! In essence, we'll be saving each woman between $1500 and $2000 in disposable diapers PER CHILD, not to mention the same savings for whatever family chooses to take a set of cloth diapers that same women created and paid forward to the local food pantry. 

What We Need & What You Get

Though Andie and Stephanie will take a very small salary for all of the work and reimbursement of items we've already purchased for this project so far, and for the three months of having to cut down hours at our jobs to make this project happen (we are the sole sources of income in both our respective families), the funds will be used for:

Sewing machines, thread, waterproof material, plastic snaps and studs, snap presses, soft 'minky' material for against babies' skin, scissors, Sharpies, and laminated patterns for EACH WOMAN being trained.  Extra funds will be for newsletters and other advertising necessities, and providing snacks and possibly child care for the mothers during their training sessions.

If our goal is not reached, be assured that your money will still go to good use! All of these materials still need to be purchased for our project!

WHAT YOU GET: 

Your choice of getting a Social Media Shout-Out, receiving a $1.00 off EVERY diaper you order in the future from one of our seamstresses for your own family's use, receiving two free customized cloth diapers, or being able to meet and greet with our entire ministry staff and the women being trained, and giving us the pleasure of taking you out to lunch!

The Impact

Green Olive Ministries has already received a small start-up grant from The Pollination Project, an environmentally-friendly group who believed in us enough to buy us a serger and get us started with our demonstration diapers we're making. They only fund projects that they feel will make a great impact in an area, so we're humbled and honored to have their support.

Our ministry believes in teaching the skills necessary to live on an extremely strained budget. This particular project, our first, will take three months but the positive results could last years on their budgets and a lifetime on their self-esteem and sense of community. Our future plans are to teach people to re-use, upcycle, plant and harvest food, be resourceful, sew, knit, crochet, cook, bake, freeze, can, dehydrate food, and so much more. These basic skills that were once common knowledge are not being taught in our culture, and our reliance on disposable items and replacing anything slightly broken or torn has depleted our resources, filled our landfills, and taken away our ability to be self-sufficient. 

It's time for a change. It's time to take steps in the right direction. It's time to get back to basics.

Please help if you can. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you don't have extra cash laying around in buckets doesn't mean you can't make an impact!

Please share our links on your own Facebook pages whenever you see them, and tell people about what Green Olive Ministries is doing. Indiegogo has some great share tools... take advantage of them, as well!

We can also use child care assistance if you're local, snack/water donations, volunteers with a heart for sewing and loving people to come see what we do and learn how to teach others, and help building an email and snail mail list for our newsletter when it starts! Contact us at GreenOliveMinistries<at>gmail<dot>com if you're interested in helping in a non-financial way.

They last for years, and can be handed down to the next child in line after potty-training. ONE SET OF THESE DIAPERS ELIMINATES AT LEAST TWO YEARS OF DISPOSABLES! In essence, we'll be saving each woman between $1500 and $2000 in disposable diapers PER CHILD, not to mention the same savings for whatever family chooses to take a set of cloth diapers that same women created and paid forward to the local food pantry. What We Need & What You GetThough Andie and Stephanie will take a very small salary for all of the work and reimbursement of items we've already purchased for this project so far, and for the three months of having to cut down hours at our jobs to make this project happen (we are the sole sources of income in both our respective families), the funds will be used for:Sewing machines, thread, waterproof material, plastic snaps and studs, snap presses, soft 'minky' material for against babies' skin, scissors, Sharpies, and laminated patterns for EACH WOMAN being trained.  Extra funds will be for newsletters and other advertising necessities, and providing snacks and possibly child care for the mothers during their training sessions.If our goal is not reached, be assured that your money will still go to good use! All of these materials still need to be purchased for our project!WHAT YOU GET: Your choice of getting a Social Media Shout-Out, receiving a $1.00 off EVERY diaper you order in the future from one of our seamstresses for your own family's use, receiving two free customized cloth diapers, or being able to meet and greet with our entire ministry staff and the women being trained, and giving us the pleasure of taking you out to lunch!The ImpactGreen Olive Ministries has already received a small start-up grant from The Pollination Project, an environmentally-friendly group who believed in us enough to buy us a serger and get us started with our demonstration diapers we're making. They only fund projects that they feel will make a great impact in an area, so we're humbled and honored to have their support.Our ministry believes in teaching the skills necessary to live on an extremely strained budget. This particular project, our first, will take three months but the positive results could last years on their budgets and a lifetime on their self-esteem and sense of community. Our future plans are to teach people to re-use, upcycle, plant and harvest food, be resourceful, sew, knit, crochet, cook, bake, freeze, can, dehydrate food, and so much more. These basic skills that were once common knowledge are not being taught in our culture, and our reliance on disposable items and replacing anything slightly broken or torn has depleted our resources, filled our landfills, and taken away our ability to be self-sufficient. It's time for a change. It's time to take steps in the right direction. It's time to get back to basics.Please help if you can. Other Ways You Can HelpJust because you don't have extra cash laying around in buckets doesn't mean you can't make an impact!Please share our links on your own Facebook pages whenever you see them, and tell people about what Green Olive Ministries is doing. Indiegogo has some great share tools... take advantage of them, as well!We can also use child care assistance if you're local, snack/water donations, volunteers with a heart for sewing and loving people to come see what we do and learn how to teach others, and help building an email and snail mail list for our newsletter when it starts! Contact us at GreenOliveMinistries<at>gmail<dot>com if you're interested in helping in a non-financial way.

story:
The Basics

Green By Force Communications ("GBFC") has developed a proprietary marketing tool -- the Green Service Announcement ("GSA").  For purposes of clarification - the GSA is something brand new and doesn't exist as yet. The simplest explanation is that it's a hybrid between a PSA (public service announcement) and a commercial. Therefore the GSA will both educate like a PSA AND sell a product that is certifiably green (not BP masquerading as a green company). We could, for example, create a GSA spot in which a household energy conservation product is used to highlight the deleterious effects of human waste/consumption.  Or climate change.  The GSA would be eligible for discounts on media buys on a scalable basis according to the ratio of public educating re environment/product selling. 

So the hard part is explaining this new tool to our first round investors. We need to raise funds to produce a high quality video that would show what's different about a GSA, how it would work, what an actual GSA would look like and how/why it would be eligible for scalable discounts.

Green By Force Communications is Five People on a Mission…

Our mission is to save the planet (yes, really!), and we need your help to get started. We have an idea: the GSA. Call it a “Green Service Announcement.” The GSA is a marketing tool that will revolutionize the green economy by leveling the playing field for green product and service companies. CERTIFIABLE companies. Greenwashers need not apply!

Once in place, the GSA will reduce the cost of the media buy, typically the largest portion of an integrated marketing campaign. This will allow our partner companies to get the word out a little louder, reduce their prices, or invest more into R&D.  All the better for you and me as consumers. The GSA simplifies decision making by giving you the assurance that these companies are truly beneficial, and knowing that your money is spent in the smartest way possible.

Our Company

Green By Force Communications (GBFC) is not a traditional company. Founded in 2011, we are a member-managed cooperative. This means that there is no hierarchy. Each member has an equal vote and an equal share in the company. We don’t have titles, only members. Meet us on our website: http://greenbyforce.com/

So that’s the first thing. Behind our environmental vision, we are on a mission to increase economic equality. Did you know that the average CEO makes 380 times more than the average employee! (http://neweconomicsinstitute.org/). This is socially unsustainable, and our cooperative model works to combat that. The GSA also works to promote economic equality by allowing the socially beneficial companies to better compete with the rest.

Green By Force is the only integrated marketing and communications company devoted exclusively to the certifiable, green economic market sector. We operate on two main principles.

1)     Link social benefit to the product. The essential pieces of the GSA are to educate and promote. The buyer has to know not only what the product does for them, but how it helps serve society or the environment better than a competing product.

2)     Completely sustainable campaigns. It’s not just the product that has to be beneficial. We will conduct campaigns that are green end-to-end, from the wages of the crew to the type of straws used to stir coffee on the set. 

What we’ve done so far…

The early months were spent a little like the first few billion years of the universe—clouds of matter swirling and forming into something recognizable.  We were gathering the right members and brainstorming to eventually come up with the GSA. With our core concept in place, we developed a business plan and a strategic plan for growth of the cooperative. We also started on the pitch to obtain angel funding. The business plan is complete (although, like the universe, expanding and evolving) and this indiegogo campaign is the final piece of the VC pitch.

The Campaign

So like we said, this indiegogo campaign is the last part of Phase One. With the indiegogo funds, we will create a high-quality video presentation to court bigger investors. With the proper backing, we will be able to concentrate full time on making the GSA an officially recognized program (working with industry, NGO partners like the NRDC, and local and federal government).

We need $20,000 to cover the costs of creating a presentation about our GSA. We have the know-how to create a really sweet presentation, "Grow Your Green," but in order to complete a truly professional project, we need your help to:

  • rent the cameras
  • lighting
  • hire the crew
  • and our multi-talented animation & motion graphics specialist, Nadav Kessous.

We believe deeply in the revolutionary capability of the GSA—we’ve already invested a lot of our own money and too many hours to count to get us where we are now. 

We’re turning to you, like-minded people, our strongest supporters, to make an investment.  

For your participation, you get…

A personalized thank you from the members of GBFC, regardless of contribution size.

$10  = A personalized card and a Green By Force logo sticker

$25  = A copy one of Riad’s albums, like Egypt, Mother of the World

$50  = Marina DeBris Pearl or double CD set

$100 = Custom Marina DeBris Jewelry

$175 = A Style Frame, designed by our animation specialist, Nadav Kessous

$500 = Custom event planning from Stephen

$1000 = A LIVE performance by Riad

SO PLEASE HELP US ACHIEVE OUR GOAL TO COVER THE COSTS OF OUR PRESENTATION. WE WANT TO TELL THE STORY OF OUR UNIQUE GSA, GROW THE GREEN ECONOMY, CREATE GREEN JOBS IN OUR COMMUNITIES AND SAVE OUR PLANET’S ENVIRONMENT. GREEN IS THE COLOR OF MONEY, TOO.

THANK YOU!

 

 

Marina DeBris Pearl

 

Animation Style Frame

 

Marina DeBris Jewelry Collection

 

EGYPT: Mother of the World CD

 

El Tarab Al Aseel CD

story:
Al Gore is training the next generation of climate leaders, and I got in!

Which is amazing, except that I'm a bit of a poor creative type.  If you've got a little to give, please help fund my trip to become a climate leader, alongside the former VP and all the fresh-faced global shapers of tomorrow.  Your donation will pay off!

"Hi Samara,

Congratulations! On behalf of The Climate Reality Project, I am thrilled to inform you that your application to the Climate Reality Leadership Corps has been accepted. We look forward to welcoming you to our three-day training with our Chairman, former U.S. Vice President Al Gore, on July 30-August 1 in Chicago, IL.

As a member of the Climate Reality Leadership Corps global network, you will join a select group of diverse, passionate, and talented volunteers from around the world. During the training you will learn about the latest science of climate change, best practices in public speaking and connecting with your audience, communication strategies, social media, leadership skills and community outreach and organizing."

It's hard to talk about the climate crisis. 

Listen, we've all experienced what works when it comes to viral campaigns we've felt compelled to share, or the cultural leaders we call heroes.  There's something magical about striking the right balance -- throwing down meaningful, relevant content but still being, ya know, fun.  Connecting with people.  Bringing the love.  When it comes to the climate crisis it's a hard balance to strike -- 'cuz man is it huge and man is it bad. 

But I want to capture the magic. 

As a speech coach, host, and content creator with a background in academia... my dream is to live at the intersection of pop culture & social change.  Inspire my generation to do what must be done, before it's too late, and have fun in the process. If you can, please help the dream become reality.  You'll own a piece of this training and I hope you'll feel like you're doing something tangible in support of a climate solution.  You absolutely are.

Thank you so much for your donation!!

$1800 covers airfare from LAX, a hotel for four nights near the training center in the South Loop area of Chicago, other transport and meals not covered by the conference, and Indiegogo fees.

And if you're not in a position to give, I totally get it!  Maybe you'll forward this link on to friends or family who care about climate defense. 

Social networking to save the world, y'all!  Thank you so much!

Global warming is the biggest problem of our era 'cuz if we don't solve it, nothing else matters.  I want to help.

But I could use some help getting there.

story:
EAST AFRICA KIVO PROJECT

My name is Lis Addison. I've been a musician, dancer, environmentalist and supporter of women's wisdom my entire life and in recent years have blended these passions into a practice called KiVo®, which is short for Kinetic Voice. KiVo is a fun and powerful art form that combines vocals, dance and rhythm and builds community.

While developing KiVo, I researched the song/dance tradition worldwide. My research took me to Kenya and Tanzania where I enjoyed KiVo like celebrations with many communities during my tree-planting service work there. Now I'm happy to be returning to plant trees in the Mulingana Primary School Yard in Kenya, share and learn more songs and dances and contribute to the livelihood of women, by opening a KiVo Sewing and Design Center in Arusha, Tanzania, which will manufacture schoolchildren's uniforms. I will also record music and video while I'm there to incorporate into the KiVo practice.

This Project is important to me because I believe that singing and dancing together is our birthright. It creates joy, cultural exchange and harmony between people, nature and spirit. I believe trees are beautiful old beings and as the lungs of the earth help to reverse the effects of global warming. I also believe that the sisters of the world must support one another and bring their voices of wisdom forward to benefit their families and the coming generations.

When I went to Mulingana Primary School in Kangundo, a county outside of Nairobi, I saw dozens of schoolchildren playing soccer with a ball they'd made out of old t-shirts. They were playing in the dusty dirt and blazing sun because there were no trees to shade them or reduce soil erosion. I made a decision right then to support The Kamba women's project which, in association with the Green Belt Movement will plant 1,000 trees in the schoolyard. We planted 3 that day. Only 9,997 more to go!

After Kenya, I went to Tanzania where I worked with teachers and students affiliated with Roots & Shoots. I taught school and the students performed my music and choreography for me, which they'd learned before I arrived! I also learned traditional Morogoro song/dances and got to plant a tree on Mt. Kilimanjaro. I have been communicating with my friends in Arusha via Facebook. They are school teachers and we have decided to open the KiVo Sewing and Design Center to support women who need jobs and children who need uniforms (all the students in E. Africa wear them-public and private).

What We Need & What You Get

Your support will provide money to buy trees, water and a caretaker who will drive a water truck for 2 years to Mulingana Primary since there are no hoses at the school in Kangundo. It will pay rent, fabric, thread and scissors for the Sewing Center in Arusha, Tanzania for one year. It will pay for the extra baggage charge for the 2  sewing machines I am taking. We already have 4 at the site. Your support will pay for my transportation to Nairobi and Kangundo with GBM to plant the trees and record the songs and dances of the Kamba community and it will pay for my transportation to Arusha to establish the KiVo Sewing and Design Center and continue recording songs and dances.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, please share this link and the Indiegogo share tools and tell your friends about us! Join us in any way you can. You are welcome to sing and dance with us, too: www.kivokineticvoice.com.

Karibu sana!

story:
HELP US TO CONSERVE THE MANGALOMA NATURE RESERVE!

The Mangaloma Nature Reserve has an extension of 200 hectares (500 acres). It is located at the western foothills of the Andean Mountain Range, in the province of Pichincha, Ecuador. Its altitude levels range from 700 to 900 m.a.s.l.

This protected area is part of the Chocó Region, which extends from Colombia to northwest Ecuador. It is well known for its high biodiversity and for the important number of endemic species. Being at immediate threat, this region is considered as a “hot spot”.

The Mangaloma Reserve stands out for its avifauna diversity. More than 290 species have been identified. Amongst them, the most prominent are the Banded Ground Cuckoo (Neomorphus radiolosus), the Umbrellabird (Cephalopterus penduliger) and the Ornate Hawk Eagle (Spizeatus ornatus), species that are almost extinct in the Chocó Region. Our web page includes a complete inventory of birds.

There are also 121 species of fine tropical trees, many of them near to extinction in cause of the progressive deforestation and monoculture in the region. The most important are the Tangare (Carapa megistocarpa) and Phitelephos aequatorialis.

Moreover, there are a great variety of animals that find refuge in the Reserve like the wild boar (Pecari tajacu), the ant eater bear (Tamandua Mexicana), rodents (Dasyprocta punctyata, Cuniculus paca), otter (Lutra longicaudis), armadillo, and even the puma (Puma concolor).

The concept of the Mangaloma Nature Reserve is to provide a self sustaining option to live in harmony with nature. That is why our basic resources come from the same reserve: solar electricity, potable water from the internal springs, organic vegetables and fruits, among others.

We work also in close contact to the surrounding communities which live in humble and marginalized conditions. So we are carrying a capacitation program to teach, through workshops, about subjects like health, organic agriculture, strengthening the communal organization, social security and the importance of living in balance with the environment. Thanks to these efforts, we have taken important steps to stop the destruction of nature in the area, contributed to well-being of the surrounding habitants and drastically reduced the hunting of wild animals.

We, María and Reinhard have maintained the reserve for about 15 years allocating our own economic resources on it.

Now we are retired and our resources are exhausted. We consider the conservation of nature is not a business. The incomes obtained from visitors are undermost and there are no governmental programs to support the reserve. So we need your help. The reserve still needs care and the community needs to improve its living conditions and welfare and also its environmental awareness.

Help us to keep the Mangaloma reserve and make a donation to support its maintenance until we find a long term and sustainable financing.

The demanded amount of 65.000 USD will permit us to maintain the reserve at least for 2 years, the space of time necessary to procure sustainable resources for the conserved area.

Your donations will be strictly used for maintenance and proper management of the reserve, especially for the ranger salary and wages for other farm workers needed occasionally, the maintenance of the infrastructure (the ranger’s house, the capacitation center used for workshops, the water supply system, solar electricity, paths trough the forest and signage), administration and public relations.

Our rewards for the donors are:

- A diploma certificating your donation and symbolic share to the Mangaloma reserve.

- A free pass which permits you to visit the Mangaloma reserve whenever you want.

- Also we will provide you periodically information about the advances in maintenance of the reserve.


We sincerely hope to have your support to continue this project, which is important for us all.

We invite you to visit Mangaloma and enjoy all its wonders. You’ll  always be welcome!


Contact us:

María Guerrero / Reinhard Krusche

Reserva Mangaloma

Post Adress:  Apartado Postal 17-22-20069, Quito, Ecuador

Phone:  (593) 2 2058250

Mobile:  (593) (0) 998712878

Mail:  mangaloma@hotmail.com

Web page:

http://www.imaymanaforestconservation.org/mangaloma.html

close contact to the surrounding communities which live in humble and marginalized

workshops, about subjects like health, organic agriculture, strengthening the
communal organization, social security and the importance of living in balance
with the environment. Thanks to these efforts, we have taken important steps to
stop the destruction of nature in the area, contributed to well-being of the
surrounding habitants and drastically reduced the hunting of wild animals.
We, María and
Reinhard have maintained the reserve for about 15 years allocating our own
economic resources on it. 
Now we are retired
and our resources are exhausted. We consider the conservation of nature is not
a business. The incomes obtained from visitors are undermost and there are no
governmental programs to support the reserve. So we need your help. The reserve
still needs care and the community needs to improve its living conditions and
welfare and also its environmental awareness.
Help us to keep the
Mangaloma reserve and make a donation to support its maintenance until we find
a long term and sustainable financing.
The demanded amount
of 65.000 USD will permit us to maintain the reserve at least for 2 years, the
space of time necessary to procure sustainable resources for the conserved
area.
Your donations will
be strictly used for maintenance and proper management of the reserve,
especially for the ranger salary and wages for other farm workers needed occasionally,
the maintenance of the infrastructure (the ranger’s house, the capacitation
center used for workshops, the water supply system, solar electricity, paths
trough the forest and signage), administration and public relations.
Our rewards for the
donors are:
- A
diploma certificating your donation and symbolic share to the Mangaloma
reserve.
- A free pass
which permits you to visit the Mangaloma reserve whenever you want.
- Also we
will provide you periodically information about the advances in maintenance of
the reserve.
We sincerely hope
to have your support to continue this project, which is important for us all. 
We invite you to
visit Mangaloma and enjoy all its wonders. You’ll  always be
welcome!

Contact us:
María
Guerrero / Reinhard Krusche
Reserva
Mangaloma
Post
Adress:  Apartado Postal 17-22-20069,
Quito, Ecuador
Phone:  (593)
2 2058250
Mobile:  (593)
(0) 998712878
Mail:  mangaloma@hotmail.com
Web page:
http://www.imaymanaforestconservation.org/mangaloma.html

story:
(#greenridertech)

as seen at


Are you tired of spending so much on fuel?


Do you want to save multiple tanks of gas a year?


Do you want control over how much gas you use?


If so, read on...

Summary 

Hi, I'm Chris! I'm a dreamer at heart, and one thing I've always thought about is tackling our subsistence on fossil fuels. Billions of gallons of fuel are wasted each year due to our driving habits... but what can you do about it, really? The problem is that we are unconscious about the fuel we use. If only there was a way for you to become aware... 

My app, GreenRider, will change the way you interact with your car as well as with others by sharing, comparing, and “gamifying” your car fuel data as you drive. Competing against your friends and network to lower your fuel consumption will provide awareness and encourage responsible use of the planet’s natural resources. Regardless of the car you drive, you can apply this knowledge to improve your driving habits and save both fuel and money. 

Take a look around, ask me a few questions, and get your own GreenRider by supporting this project. You'll help us all out in the end.

Actual Screenshot 


How does it work? 

With your mobile phone and a simple OBD-II plug-in device (see below), GreenRider will make saving fuel a game. 


Your real time fuel consumption habits will be automatically shared and compared among users. In effect, GreenRider will nudge you toward both gasoline and financial savings. 

What I Need, and What You Get 

There are a bunch of nice rewards to select. Here is the quick description of the core perks:

  • You fund me $10: you pre-order to get the app. Find an OBD-II connector to connect with your car (required for the app to function) and you're golden. 

  • You fund me $30: you pre-order to get the app ... PLUS  get a tested OBD-II device (the Bronze "Starter" Package option on the right --->)

  • You fund me $60: you pre-order the app and OBD-II connector and I make you a core member of my beta testing team (Silver "Beta" Package --->)

If you use the app and change your habits, the app can more than pay for itself over 12 months:

Why Indiegogo?

You might think, "if you already have a prototype, why are you asking for more money?"  Last fall at the White House, I was really encouraged by an amazing set of folks I met in the Tech and Innovation division of the Office of Science and Technology Policy. When I finished my fellowship, I made the choice to focus all my energy on new ideas, came up with GreenRider, and assembled a team to build it. However, setting out on your own to create something innovative costs money and my funds are running dry. Your contributions to GreenRider will go towards:

Upgrade Value

To give you a better idea what value each Flex/Choice goal upgrade will provide to your GreenRider, here are some more detailed descriptions:

What makes GreenRider different?

I recognize there are several mobile apps and OBD-II devices for your car. To put it bluntly, this will be a "lean" tool built for ecofriendly, fuel-conscious car drivers - first and foremost.

  • No motor/engine check diagnostic function  
  • No route planning software
  • No extraneous features
  • No kitchen sink

Sure, I want lots of helpful features that will help you conserve, but I need your help to build them. Support the movement and get your own GreenRider!

Pilot Planning

When I competed at the TEDxFulbright Social Innovation Challenge earlier in April, I discovered another entry that had some overlapping interests. Lawrence On-Board is a network of "roadside ridesharers," and many of its drivers are naturally interested in minimizing their car fuel waste. I am currently in talks with its founder about piloting GreenRider in the Lawrence On-Board network.

Concluding Thoughts 

There are many ways you can increase your car's MPG and save fuel... my purpose is to help you want to seek them.

Braking less, more frequent tune-ups, and less-aggressive driving are just a few common sense ways you can save. Indeed, there are even groups of "hypermilers" out there who have perfected fuel efficient techniques for years. These folks have achieved stunning increases in MPG sometime beyond the car manufacturer's intent. 

So what does this mean? The answer: anyone can conserve, and you really aren't required to buy an expensive new car or own a hybrid to save fuel. GreenRider will help make it possible for you to be an ecofriendly driver regardless of your car class, make, or model. 

Other Ways You Can Help 

  • Make some noise and get the message out - share the campaign!
  • Subscribe to the GreenRider mailing list here 
  • Subscribe to my start-up blog over here

story:
Summary

The Eco Barn Project is at the heart of our vision to transform our organic farm into a learning and inspiration center that explores new ways of sustainable farming, that connects people with rich natural ecosystems and that offers a unique meeting place for great conversations and big thoughts. 

We would be truly grateful if you would like to join us, choose one of the rewards to the right and help make this project happen, creating a significant positive impact in several areas:

  • New ideas, perspectives and inspiration that improves society
  • More sustainable and thriving people and organizations.
  • The spreading of brand new green technologies for a sustainable future 
  • Climate change reversal by creating one of the worlds first carbon negative buildings


A Vision to Make a Difference

Our vision is to create a farm sanctuary where people get a break from the everyday speed of life to be able to relax, learn and reflect, leaving energized with new insights to make better choices and decisions for the whole.

The heart will be our charming old red, but very worn down barn, that we want to rebuild into a beautiful green demonstration and inspiration building with a spacious classroom, a farm to table restaurant, a winter garden and of course great rooms to stay in, all built with natural materials combined with cutting edge sustainable solutions.

To the Eco Barn you could come for a class in organic gardening or a conference where leading experts share perspectives on future proof sustainable farming. You can stay here with your children to experience an ecosystem full of exciting life. You can go on a corporate retreat to this very calm and creative environment, inspiring full focus and new ideas. Or you can spend a weekend for yourself attending yoga workshops as well as plant based cooking classes with inspiring chefs and all the ingredients coming fresh from the farm.



What We Believe

The farm is located in the beautiful Swedish countryside by lake, field and forest, at the end of the road, a little bit more than an hour from Stockholm. It is run by us, Julia and Carl, our gardener Sina and volunteers from all over the world.

The inspiration to sell our comfortable new house and embark on a farm transformation journey followed the birth of our son, Leopold. What would the world look like when he turned thirty? We saw how too many social and environmental development curves pointed in the wrong direction. We thought we as a society needed to rethink and act much more holistically, and we realized that we could make a positive contribution to this development.

 In the last four years we have worked hard to restore, renew and change an old conventional farm into a much richer organic ecosystem. Now we are ready to take the next step and create an impact way beyond the farm borders.


Who We Are

Julia has a background in marketing and communication. After studying in London she worked for MTV Networks International. During this time she discovered yoga and trained as a yoga teacher. Today Julia runs the farm guesthouse. She loves to connect with the visitors and to make everyone feel welcome. Julia is a trained beekeeper and permaculture designer. She is also a certified Iyengar yoga teacher. She looks forward to develop high quality workshops at the farm, including yoga, organic and biodiverse gardening, and healthy and sustainable cooking in collaboration with some of the most inspiring chefs.

Carl has a Master of Science degree from Stockholm School of Economics and started his career as management consultant at McKinsey & Co. Since 2004 he has been an independent trainer and consultant focusing on inspiring purpose driven and sustainable leadership in organizations. Carl is also a trained permaculture designer and applies a system perspective on how we can make our soil more alive and fertile since this is the foundation for everything at an organic farm. One of Carl’s long-term aspirations is to be able to show how human systems and organizations can learn from natural systems, and to arrange workshops and conferences on how we can build richer ecosystems for the future.

You can read more about us and our farm adventure at our website Lindeborgs Gård.


Ready to Go

We cannot wait to push the go-button to realize the Eco Barn Project, a unique 1100 square meter learning and inspiration center. We have worked hard during one and a half year together with White Arkitekter, our architects. Now all the drawings are complete, the building permit is in place, we have harvested and sawed the wood needed and we have done loads of research to make sure we integrate the most promising and innovative sustainable technologies (read more about them at the end of this page).

We believe the Eco Barn is truly unique, as it will house a multitude of different functions all supporting each other. There will be carbon negative production of electricity, a processing chain for old Swedish heritage grains and other farm produce such as honey. As a guest you will be able to eat delicious organic food in our farm restaurant, and stay in rooms made out of the wood from our forest, all designed and furnished with natural organic materials. You will be able to go to classes or have meetings in the the classroom overlooking the lake. And you will be able to recharge in the sauna, the winter garden or by the naturally clear pond. You will be able to experience all systems in action, connecting you with nature, a living soil and the origins of food. You will be in the middle of it all. 


What We Need to Get Going

The challenge for us is that the scope of our holistic project is large and that innovative sustainable solutions are costly. We can finance part of the investment ourselves through savings and loans, the Swedish Environmental Protection Agency will support part of the investment in the energy solutions, but we still need additional funding to get going. The crowdfunding campaign plays a critical role here. 

We would love to have you onboard this exciting journey and your support will help us bring the Eco Barn vision to life. The funds from the crowdfunding will go to four important parts of this project: 

  • The Creative Farm Dojo ($100 000)
    With a stunning view over the lake and the fields where the veggies for today’s meals may just be harvested, the farm dojo will be a special place, the most important one at the farm. Dojo means a place for studies and this is where trainings, workshops and creative meetings will take place. Here people with different backgrounds and perspectives will meet to learn and to explore how we practically can build a better, more sustainable world. In the ceiling you see the original wooden framework of the barn and the wooden floors will be made with new timber from our forest. This will be a place for both stillness and creativity, a place for big thoughts, deep insight and conversations that make a difference.
  • The Winter Garden Learning Space ($100 000)
    To make the barn into a real living ecosystem itself, we will integrate a combined winter garden and green house. Here people can get the benefits of green plant presence also in winter and we can produce delicious green leaves and vegetables for the farm to table kitchen, all year round. This space will be a green room for learning and relaxation and also the perfect place to experience delicious organic food from the     surrounding farm ecosystem.
  • Nature in the walls – wool and linen insulation ($30 000)
    A healthy and sustainable building is made by natural and renewable materials. We will need 400 cubic meters of wonderful wool and linen insulation to make the barn warm, cozy and energy efficient.
  • Releasing Plant Power – an innovative water cleaning system ($30 000)
    The water cleaning system will be biological, using a new technology that fulfills the strictest rules and regulations by using a mix of plants to clean all the waste water from the building. The solution includes a unique phosphor trap to prevent leakage and to make it possible to reuse these nutrients.

If this project can attract more funds than the requested $260 000 we would be absolutely thrilled. This would help us fund:

  • The Eco Barn Farm to Table Restaurant and Cooking Studio ($150 000)
    A creative restaurant where you see the chefs in action or participate yourself in the cooking experience is one of the best ways to help people connect to the origins of food and the quality of sustainable farming. Working with a skilled kitchen consultant and chef, we have planned for a wonderful, open restaurant kitchen in the Eco Barn designed for our guests to really get engaged in the processing, cooking and savoring of the farm's organic produce. A unique feature is the attached Winter Garden where green leaves and vegetables will be produced all year round. A wood stove used for cooking will also be integrated in the kitchen.

Our Sister Campaign - The Carbon Negative Project
The Eco Barn will be a demonstration site for a truly unique combination of energy solutions, using solar power, biochar and sterling engines. These solutions will make the carbon footprint of the building negative which means that the more we use the building the less CO2 in the atmosphere and the more we help to reverse global warming. We believe that these solutions, that we want to help to test, demonstrate and spread, make up a big part of the solution for the climate challenge that we together face. To be able to share the whole story around these amazing technologies we created a separate crowd funding campaign called The Carbon Negative Project.


How We Can Give Back

We are truly grateful if you would like to join us and help us make the Eco Barn vision possible. As a way to acknowledge your support we have developed a number of exciting ways to say thank you and give value back to you. 

The Pioneer Discount!
We would love to meet you at the Eco Barn the day we open and are happy to offer  a 25% pioneer discount on your first Eco Barn experiences. This is valid to anyone contributing with $50 or more, and applies to everything at the farm including farm stays, tours, classes, conferences and workshops, our organic products, restaurant meals and so on. The discount extends one year from the day we open the Eco Barn on purchases up to a total value of $10 000. 

The Eco Barn Friends Signboard
When you support the campaign, you and everybody else that contributed, will be thanked by having your names and countries appear on a large beautiful signboard near the Eco Barn entrance (unless you prefer to remain anonymous of course).

Here is a summary of the Perk Packages:

  • Eco Barn Friend
  • "Greener" - E-book or Printed Copy 
  • Tree Supporter
  • Organic Illustrations
  • Lamb Supporter
  • Scything Course
  • Bee Supporter
  • Farm Visit VIP Package
  • Main Sponsor of the Ecobarn
  • Water Renewal Champion
  • Sustainable Learning Champion
  • Green Power Champion

These perks are detailed to the right of the page. You can also read more about some of them below.

"Greener" - Creating a Farm Sanctuary Together With Nature

During the four years that we have been working to improve and develop the ecosystems around the farm, we have learnt a lot. In this book you will visit the farm and see how far we have come up until today. We also share many useful ways to enrich any ecosystem, whether it is a balcony, a small villa garden or a large farm. The 70-page book is designed to be a source of inspiration with lots of photos and wonderful illustrations made by our talented gardener Sina.

We are really happy that we can share the farm adventure with you in this way. The book is available as E-book and in a printed copy.  We will start sending out the e-book by email from May 15 and the printed version from May 25.


A Chance to Share Your Inspiration - Adopting a Tree
Trees are the tallest, most proud green presences in the ecosystem, benefitting both humans, birds and insects with their flowers and fruits. As a way to say thank for adopting one of the fruit trees, that are to be planted in Eco Barn orchard, this tree will have your name and your favorite inspirational quote on a badge hanging from one of the branches, inspiring all the Eco Barn visitors winding down and contemplating in the orchard.

A Chance to get Creative - Naming the Bees and the Lambs
Both our newly born lambs and our honeybees are highly valued at the farm. You can leave an imprint by supporting them and help us naming either a lamb or a bee hive. You will see the result through a high quality digital photo and a film shot.

Organic illustrations of the beauty of the plant world
Sina who has been working with us for two years at the farm is a truly gifted illustrator. One of her specialities is capturing the beauty of the plant world.

In a limited edition we have printed two wonderful illustrations, "Edible Flowers" and Saving Your Own Tomato Seeds", that you could receive, depicting aspects of the rich farm ecosystem. The prints are professionally made on high quality paper and ready to be framed. The size is 210 × 297 millimetre. 

The prints are numbered and of course signed by Sina. You can check out more of her work at Instagram "Three Hazels".

"Edible Flowers"




"Saving your own tomato seeds"


Leaving a Legacy - Champions and Main Sponsors

We really believe the Eco Barn is a unique project that will make a significant positive contribution to the world beyond the farm borders. We we would love to long-term team up with a number of people and organizations that share our values and beliefs and that would like to get involved with financial support and potentially also with other forms of collaboration. You will be the Champions of the Eco Barn Project and our Main Sponsors. In the perks presentation to the right we describe the different roles and some ways we can give back in exchange for your very important and generous support. We are also very open to your own ideas on how we can create a long-term win-win collaboration centering around sustainability, learning and innovation.

What happens with the contributions if the funding target is not met?

If the crowdfunding target is not met fully, your contribution to this campaign will still be used for the Eco Barn Project. Either we will be able to realize the full vision by finding complementing sources of financing, or we will kick in the persistant part of ourselves and start with part of the project, realizing the full vision step by step over time.


The Impact

We cannot wait to get going! We wish to put all the planning and preparations done so far into action as soon as possible, aiming to open the Eco Barn in 2017. Your support will help enable this project and the surrounding ecosystems to make a significant positive impact in several areas:

  • New ideas, perspectives and inspiration that improves society
    The world needs more meeting places where human systems connect with natural systems, meeting places where different perspectives meet and new positive ideas arise to be spread and put into action. The Eco Barn is designed in every detail to enable this kind of meetings, courses and conversations.
  • Sustainable and thriving people and organizations
    The Eco Barn will be a unique farm sanctuary enabling people to get in contact with nature and themselves. To be able to thrive in our fast paced society we believe that people, teams and organizations need space to breathe every now and then. We all need space to lift the gaze, to renew ourselves, to recharge. We need to distance ourselves from the action every now and then to be able to see the whole picture, make better choices and come back with more and energy and stronger intent.
  • Spreading of brand new green technologies for a sustainable future
    We want the Eco Barn to be a unique building that tells stories of hope and possibility. One really important story will be around the green technologies, a story that we believe will spread and help make many more building much more green, benefitting both people and environment.
  • Climate change reversal by creating one of the worlds first carbon negative buildings
    The building will be self sufficient when it comes to energy production based on technology that help us store carbon in the soil. The more we use  the building, the better for the climate and the generations to come.

Thank You for Joining Us!

We hope that you have become as excited about the Eco Barn Project as we are. We are truly grateful if you would like to join us and contribute to making this project happen. It would mean a lot to us and make a real difference.

You can also make an impact by helping us to spread the word to as many people as possible that you think would find the project exciting. Two great ways are of course sharing this campaign on your favorite social media using the Indiegogo sharing tools and sending an email to people you believe would be particularly interested.

Please also stay in touch and follow us through the farm's website, facebook page, instagram flow and blog. At the website you can also sign up for our newsletter.

Thank You Again! 

Julia & Carl



Read More About Our Green Solutions

Part of the vision is that this will become a unique demonstration building that contributes positively to surrounding ecosystems. We believe it is possible to design systems in a way that the more a building is used the better for the environment. The barn will become such a building. We hope that the solutions and systems that we put in place also can inspire many other to choose more green technologies and materials when building. Below are some of the most important sustainable solutions.

  • The barn will be rebuilt using our own timber from the forest. The logs have been pulled out by horse to avoid ground damage and converted into construction wood and planks by a local saw mill. Using a lot of wood in the building makes the building itself a carbon sink, storing carbon dioxide (CO2).
  • In addition to wood we will use as much other renewable and natural materials as possible. The insulation in the walls and in the ceiling will be made out of sheep wool and linen and the insulation in the foundation will consist of recycled glass that is puffed up with air.
  • The water cleaning system will be biological. We use a new technology that fulfills the strictest rules and regulations while still using plants to clean all the grey and black water from the building.
  • The organically certified farm to table restaurant will use absolutely fresh and local products from the farm. We will have a big focus on high quality plant based food. There will be a processing chain in the barn to make fresh flour from the grains we produce and a green house attached to the kitchen so green produce will always be available to the chefs, even in the wintertime.
  • The heating system will be carbon dioxide negative, which is quite unique in the world. This means that the more we heat the building, the less CO2 in the atmosphere. This is done through a process called pyrolysis, in which organic matter, such as oat shells from the fields and wood chippings from the forest, are decoupled into heat gas and biochar. Biochar is basically what you use in the grill in the summer. The heat gas heats water that will circulate through a radiator system warming up the whole building. The biochar contains all the CO2 from the wood. So instead of releasing it back to the atmosphere, which is normally what happens when you burn wood, we can now add it back to the soil. The soil then stores the CO2 for hundreds to thousands of years while new trees grow up in the forest absorbing more CO2 from the atmosphere. Learn more at The Carbon Negative Project Campaign.
  • The barn will have its own electricity production, partly using solar power and partly using sterling engines. The sterling engines run on the heat gases from the pyrolysis process. They have a maximum effect of 10000 watt per engine and are able to power the whole farm operation. 

Some more images from the farm:
